Press Round Up.
------------------------------------------------

Spurs remain interested in signing Geremany U21 international Max Meyer this summer however his club, Schalke are holding out for a fee closer to £30m for the player. Spurs are said to be willing to go as high as £20m and are leaving it late in the window in the hope a deal can be reached.

(Bild)
------------------------------------------------

Manchester City academy star Jadon Sancho has put both Spurs and Arsenal on alert by stating he does not wish to remain at Man City as he wants to join a club where he feels he can progress to the first team. Man City hope an offer of £30,000 a week to the 17yr old will keep him at their academy.

(Daily Mirror)
------------------------------------------------

Spurs have asked to keep apprised of movements of Leicester forward Mahrez as they look to secure reinforcements for next season. Leicester have conceded the player has asked to leave however will not budge from their £50m valuation; a fee Spurs will not be willing to pay.

(The Sun)
------------------------------------------------

Spurs are continuing to monitor a number of right backs across Europe but will not make any moves until after the three game tour of the USA where they will watch Kieran Tripper and academy full back Kyle Walker-Peters in action against tough opposition.

(The Sun)
------------------------------------------------

AC Milan have confirmed that Suso will not be leaving the Italian club this summer despite interest from a number of clubs including Premier League runners up Spurs.

(The Sun / Sky Sports Italy)
------------------------------------------------

Arsenal, Man Utd and Chelsea have all now shown an interest in signing Ross Barkley with Everton hoping to create a bidding war for the midfielder the longer it goes into the window.

(Daily Start)
------------------------------------------------

Tottenham are set to offer Croatian midfielder Kovacic of Real Madrid a seasons loan deal in order to secure his services with an option to buy.

(Daily Express)
------------------------------------------------

Spurs have rejected an offer of £60m for Eric Dier by simply refusing to answer any attempts at contact from Manchester Utd. Spurs chairman Daniel Levy made it clear to clubs and agents only Kyle Walker was available for sale and has stuck to that regardless of the offers being made.

(Daily Express / Sky Sports News)
------------------------------------------------

Friday 21st July 2017.

Source: SpursNews Facebook

Wanyama clearly has an ankle/leg injury..

Just asked Poch if we should expect any new signings, to which he replied 'we are working on it', with a laugh.

Dele, Eric, Christian, Hugo, Ben enjoying lunch together at the hotel. Belgian boys (and Janssen) sitting adjacent. Boys are having fun.

More notes: Wimmer seemed a bit excluded/unsettled. KWP was swapping in & out for Trippier. Dier very involved. Winks sprayed some beauties.

Hugo Lloris and Mousa Dembele have defended Tottenham’s lack of activity in the transfer market.

In quotes published by Sky, Dembele said: “I think the way we do it is very good. We don’t change five or six players every season because that means you have to start over with new players.

“We concentrate on the team we have now. If the team stays like this, we know that we’re going to have a good season like last year. The quality we have now; everybody is looking in the same direction.

“We’re very positive. For us it’s like a family. It’s a very good thing to have a group that stays together and understands each other as well.”

Captain Lloris was also calm about the situation, telling Sky: “Honestly I don’t care about that (transfers). It belongs to the chairman and the manager. I’m just a player and I’m committed to my team.

“We trust each other. We’re used to working together for a while now and we will be ready to be competitive again this season.”

OK — it’s unlikely any Spurs player is going to come out and criticise the lack of business. But the above quotes suggest there is very little negativity among the players when it comes to transfers. The fans, however, remain divided on the issue.

Kane: “Totti is my idol.”

Harry Kane praised Francesco Totti during an interview released on the eve of the Tottenham-Roma match valid for the International Champions Cup (scheduled kick-off for 2:05 this night). The conference was focused on the US tour of the Londoners, but the question about Totti was inevitable. “What a player! He’s one of the best strikers I’ve ever played.

All the other players have full respect for him, I only heard good things about him and for me it is an idol, one of my growth models for my role. It is definitely someone who can be cited in terms of love for his club. I’ve been with the Spurs for 13 years, it’s been a long time, and I hope to stay here for many more years. ”

In LONDON – He grew up in Tottenham youth football, Kane has played for other teams always and only on loan, thus remaining the property of the Spurs. With them he plays stably since 2013, at the end of a loan to Leicester. Vulcan in last season with the Spurs shirt: in 38 appearances he scored 35 goals, including 2 in the Champions League.
